works.title: On the Shortness of Life
works.author: Seneca
works.summary: A Stoic meditation on the nature of time and how to live meaningfully within our limited lifespan.

works.title: The American Scholar
works.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
works.summary: Emerson's call for American intellectual independence and the role of the scholar in society.

works.title: On Civil Disobedience
works.author: Henry David Thoreau
works.summary: Thoreau's influential argument for individual resistance to unjust government and laws.

works.title: The Decay of Lying
works.author: Oscar Wilde
works.summary: Wilde's paradoxical defense of art over nature and lying over truth in aesthetic theory.

works.title: Walking
works.author: Henry David Thoreau
works.summary: Thoreau's meditation on the importance of walking and contact with wild nature for human well-being.

works.title: Experience
works.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
works.summary: Emerson explores the limitations of human experience and knowledge in understanding reality.

works.title: The Soul of Man Under Socialism
works.author: Oscar Wilde
works.summary: Wilde's vision of how socialism could liberate individual creativity and artistic expression.

works.title: Nature
works.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
works.summary: Emerson's foundational transcendentalist essay on humanity's relationship with the natural world.

works.title: Of Studies
works.author: Francis Bacon
works.summary: Bacon's concise and practical advice on the purposes and methods of learning and study.

works.title: The Over-Soul
works.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
works.summary: Emerson's exploration of the universal spirit that connects all individuals and nature.

works.title: On Friendship
works.author: Michel de Montaigne
works.summary: Montaigne's profound meditation on the nature of true friendship and human connection.

works.title: The Work of Art in the Age of Mechanical Reproduction
works.author: Walter Benjamin
works.summary: Benjamin's influential analysis of how technology changes the nature and function of art.

works.title: A Modest Proposal
works.author: Jonathan Swift
works.summary: Swift's devastating satirical attack on English treatment of the Irish poor through an outrageous proposal.

works.title: The Protestant Ethic and the Spirit of Capitalism
works.author: Max Weber
works.summary: Weber's analysis of how Protestant religious ideas influenced the development of capitalism.

works.title: On Liberty
works.author: John Stuart Mill
works.summary: Mill's foundational liberal argument for individual freedom and the limits of social authority.

works.title: The Myth of Sisyphus
works.author: Albert Camus
works.summary: Camus's meditation on the absurd condition of human existence and how to live meaningfully within it.

works.title: Education
works.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
works.summary: Emerson's thoughts on true education as the development of individual potential and character.

works.title: On the Sublime and Beautiful
works.author: Edmund Burke
works.summary: Burke's influential analysis of the psychological sources of aesthetic experience.

works.title: The Poet
works.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
works.summary: Emerson's vision of the poet's role as interpreter of nature and human experience.

works.title: On Truth and Lying in a Nonmoral Sense
works.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
works.summary: Nietzsche's early critique of absolute truth and exploration of language as metaphor.

works.title: Compensation
works.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
works.summary: Emerson's exploration of the natural law of balance and compensation in moral and natural realms.

works.title: The Economic and Philosophic Manuscripts
works.author: Karl Marx
works.summary: Marx's early analysis of alienated labor and human nature under capitalism.

works.title: Of the Standard of Taste
works.author: David Hume
works.summary: Hume's attempt to establish objective standards for aesthetic judgment and taste.

works.title: Circles
works.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
works.summary: Emerson's meditation on the cyclical nature of growth and the infinite expansion of human consciousness.

works.title: The Essayist
works.author: Alexander Smith
works.summary: Smith's charming reflection on the art of essay writing and personal literary expression.

works.title: The Yellow Wallpaper
works.author: Charlotte Perkins Gilman
works.summary: A woman's descent into madness while confined by her husband's "rest cure" treatment.

works.title: The Lottery
works.author: Shirley Jackson
works.summary: A small town's annual lottery reveals the dark power of unexamined tradition and mob mentality.

works.title: Bartleby, the Scrivener
works.author: Herman Melville
works.summary: A law clerk's passive resistance with his repeated phrase "I would prefer not to" disrupts a Wall Street office.

works.title: The Open Boat
works.author: Stephen Crane
works.summary: Four men stranded at sea face an indifferent universe while forming bonds of human solidarity.

works.title: An Occurrence at Owl Creek Bridge
works.author: Ambrose Bierce
works.summary: A Confederate sympathizer's final moments before execution stretch into an elaborate escape fantasy.

works.title: The Story of an Hour
works.author: Kate Chopin
works.summary: A woman's complex emotional journey upon learning of her husband's death in a train accident.

works.title: To Build a Fire
works.author: Jack London
works.summary: A man's fatal journey through the Yukon wilderness demonstrates nature's indifference to human life.

works.title: The Cask of Amontillado
works.author: Edgar Allan Poe
works.summary: A carefully planned murder carried out in the catacombs beneath an Italian palazzo.

works.title: Young Goodman Brown
works.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
works.summary: A young Puritan's night journey into the forest challenges his faith and view of his community.

works.title: The Blue Hotel
works.author: Stephen Crane
works.summary: A paranoid man's fear creates the very violence he expects at a frontier hotel.

works.title: Désirée's Baby
works.author: Kate Chopin
works.summary: A tragic tale of love destroyed by racial prejudice and assumptions about identity in Louisiana.

works.title: The Beast in the Jungle
works.author: Henry James
works.summary: A man's lifelong obsession with a vague future catastrophe blinds him to present love and life.

works.title: Paul's Case
works.author: Willa Cather
works.summary: A Pittsburgh youth's aesthetic sensibilities and class aspirations lead to desperate actions.

works.title: The Turn of the Screw
works.author: Henry James
works.summary: A governess's account of supernatural encounters with ghostly former employees at a country estate.

works.title: Roman Fever
works.author: Edith Wharton
works.summary: Two American women in Rome reveal long-hidden secrets about their past rivalry and friendship.

works.title: The Real Thing
works.author: Henry James
works.summary: An artist discovers that authentic aristocrats make poor models compared to professional models posing as aristocrats.

works.title: The Celebrated Jumping Frog of Calaveras County
works.author: Mark Twain
works.summary: A tall tale about a gambling man and his trained frog in a California mining camp.

works.title: Rappaccini's Daughter
works.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
works.summary: A young man falls in love with a woman made poisonous by her father's scientific experiments.

works.title: The Country of the Blind
works.author: H.G. Wells
works.summary: A sighted man discovers a valley of blind people who consider sight a disability and madness.

works.title: A Wagner Matinee
works.author: Willa Cather
works.summary: A Nebraska farm woman's rare return to Boston awakens painful memories of her sacrificed musical life.

works.title: The Machine Stops
works.author: E.M. Forster
works.summary: A prescient vision of humanity's complete dependence on technology and the consequences of that dependence.

works.title: The Metamorphosis
works.author: Franz Kafka
works.summary: A traveling salesman awakens transformed into a giant insect, exploring themes of isolation and family duty.

works.title: The Dead
works.author: James Joyce
works.summary: A Dublin dinner party leads to profound revelations about love, death, and the weight of the past.

works.title: Araby
works.author: James Joyce
works.summary: A boy's romantic quest to buy a gift at a bazaar becomes a journey into disillusionment and self-awareness.

works.title: The Garden Party
works.author: Katherine Mansfield
works.summary: A wealthy family's garden party is disrupted by news of a working man's accidental death nearby.

works.title: Annabel Lee
works.author: Edgar Allan Poe
works.summary: A haunting ballad about the narrator's undying love for his deceased beloved Annabel Lee.

works.title: I Hear America Singing
works.author: Walt Whitman
works.summary: A celebration of American workers and the diverse voices that make up the democratic nation.

works.title: Stopping by Woods on a Snowy Evening
works.author: Robert Frost
works.summary: A traveler's moment of contemplation in snowy woods before returning to life's obligations and duties.

works.title: The Waste Land
works.author: T.S. Eliot
works.summary: A complex modernist exploration of spiritual and cultural decay in post-World War I civilization.

works.title: Mending Wall
works.author: Robert Frost
works.summary: Two neighbors repair their stone wall each spring while questioning the need for barriers between people.

works.title: The Second Coming
works.author: W.B. Yeats
works.summary: A prophetic vision of historical cycles and the collapse of Christian civilization into chaos.

works.title: Dover Beach
works.author: Matthew Arnold
works.summary: A meditation on the loss of religious faith in the modern world, set against the Dover seashore.

works.title: Song of Myself
works.author: Walt Whitman
works.summary: Whitman's celebration of the individual self as connected to all humanity and nature.

works.title: The Raven
works.author: Edgar Allan Poe
works.summary: A grieving man is visited by a talking raven whose repeated "Nevermore" drives him to despair.

works.title: Fire and Ice
works.author: Robert Frost
works.summary: A brief meditation on whether the world will end in fire (desire) or ice (hatred).

works.title: We Wear the Mask
works.author: Paul Laurence Dunbar
works.summary: The necessity of hiding true feelings and identity behind a social mask, particularly for African Americans.

works.title: Chicago
works.author: Carl Sandburg
works.summary: A proud celebration of Chicago as the "Hog Butcher for the World" and symbol of American industrial might.

works.title: The Wild Swans at Coole
works.author: W.B. Yeats
works.summary: The poet contemplates the unchanging beauty of swans while reflecting on his own aging and change.

works.title: Kubla Khan
works.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge
works.summary: A dreamlike vision of Kubla Khan's pleasure palace in Xanadu, exploring the power of poetic imagination.

works.title: When Lilacs Last in the Dooryard Bloom'd
works.author: Walt Whitman
works.summary: Whitman's great elegy for Abraham Lincoln and meditation on death, grief, and national healing.

works.title: The Hollow Men
works.author: T.S. Eliot
works.summary: A bleak portrait of spiritual emptiness and moral paralysis in the modern world.

works.title: Jabberwocky
works.author: Lewis Carroll
works.summary: A playful nonsense poem about a hero's quest to slay the fearsome Jabberwock with invented vocabulary.

works.title: The Lady of Shalott
works.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
works.summary: A mysterious lady weaves images of the outside world until love draws her from isolation to tragic fate.

works.title: Birches
works.author: Robert Frost
works.summary: The poet's meditation on birch trees bent by ice storms becomes reflection on escape, return, and resilience.

works.title: Sympathy
works.author: Paul Laurence Dunbar
works.summary: The caged bird's song becomes a metaphor for the African American experience under oppression.

works.title: The Tyger
works.author: William Blake
works.summary: Blake's famous questions about the divine creator who made both the gentle lamb and fierce tiger.

works.title: Crossing Brooklyn Ferry
works.author: Walt Whitman
works.summary: Whitman's meditation on the eternal human connections across time while crossing the East River.

works.title: Acquainted with the Night
works.author: Robert Frost
works.summary: A solitary walk through the city at night becomes an exploration of spiritual and emotional isolation.

works.title: Sailing to Byzantium
works.author: W.B. Yeats
works.summary: An aging poet's desire to escape physical decay and achieve spiritual transcendence through art.

works.title: Ode to a Nightingale
works.author: John Keats
works.summary: Keats's meditation on the contrast between human mortality and the immortal beauty of the nightingale's song.
